newsitem.title: USA: NationsBank accused of discrimination - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: NationsBank accused of discrimination - WSJ.

text.p: The U.S. Labor Department filed a complaint against NationsBank Corp Friday, alleging that in 1993 the bank used hiring and selection procedures that discriminated against qualified minority applicants for entry level clerical jobs, The Wall Street Journal said.
In Monday's electronic edition, the paper said the administrative complaint indicated the practices involved nearly 1,500 people.
The paper quoted a Labor Department official as saying: "There were 1,500 qualified applicants who were disproportionately rejected for employment.
"We couldn't find any nondiscriminatory reason for their not being hired," the official told the paper.
The complaint could lead to the bank being barred from receiving federal contracts, the paper said, although such actions are rare.
NationsBank on Friday said it had "demonstrated a commitment to diversity," adding that it was illegal for the Labor Department to demand race-based quotas in hiring practices, the article said.
